revision.text:
{{Top-bottle}}{{Item|title1=Water Bottle|research=Water Bottling|sellValue={{Money|174}}|itemImage=Icon-water-bottle.png|resValue={{RP|20x }}}} ==Information== '''Water Bottle''' is a [[Plastic Pellets|Plastic]] sellable product that was added in {{Update|0.7.0}}. It is produced by the [[Bottling Plant]] by combining [[Filtered Water]] and [[Plastic Bottle|Plastic Bottles]]. Each bottle sells for {{Money|174}} and usually can be amassed in medium volumes.
Selling '''Water Bottles''' is usually the easiest way to sell [[Plastic Bottle|Bottled]] liquids compared to the [[Refined Diesel Bottle]] and [[Oil Bottle]] as it is extremely easy to mass produce the [[Filtered Water]].
==Usage== The obvious purpose of the '''Water Bottle''' is to be sold in [[Truck Depot|Truck Depots]] for [[Money]]. However, producing the [[Plastic Pellets|Plastic]] required for the [[Plastic Bottle|Plastic Bottles]] can be tricky, especially if it is the player's first time dealing with [[Plastic Production Facility|Plastic Production]]. Once a player masters how to lay out [[Plastic Pellets|Plastic]] factories, they will be able to make a decent amount of [[Money]] for [[Money Making#Middle Game|Mid-Game]] that's is plausible, but when compared the [[Money|Price]] of [[Gearbox|Gearboxes]] it produces significantly less [[Money]].
Selling [[Gearbox|Gearboxes]] is usually the better option and should be sold instead of '''Water Bottles''' yielding much more [[Money]], however '''Water Bottles''' do have two advantages over the [[Gearbox]] being:
* Setting up [[Filtered Water]] production is significantly simpler than a [[Crankshaft]] setup. * You can easily produce more [[Plastic Pellets|Plastic]] compared to [[Steel Ingot|Steel]] from [[Blast Furnace]]s.
Even a small inefficient plastic farm can easily support a massive [[Crankshaft]] factory, therefore the player should use the overflow [[Plastic Pellets|Plastic]] from [[Gearbox]] production to create '''Water Bottles''' to maximise profits.
== Recipes == {{Production|input1=filtered-water|Input1Amount=8|input2=plastic-bottle|Input2Amount=1|time=3.5|Mamyflux=2.86kMF|output1=water-bottle|Output1Amount=1|machine=Bottling Plant}}
==Gallery== <gallery> File:Water Bottle Factory.png|Compact '''Water Bottle''' factory. File:Plastic Bottling Setup.png|Less compact '''Water Bottle''' factory. </gallery>
==Trivia== *'''Water Bottles''' have the exact same selling price as [[Plastic Casing]], which requires double the [[Plastic Pellet|Pellets]] per unit produced, however [[Plastic Casing]] is used in [[Gearbox]] production, which has an extremely high selling price per unit.
[[Category:Items]] {{Items Navbox}}

{{Item|sell_value=|itemImage=icon-pta.png|research=Plastics|sellValue={{Money|2.9|size=8}}|resValue={{RP|0.2x }}}} ==Information== '''PTA''' is a liquid that combines [[Paraxylene]] with [[Acetic Acid]] inside a [[Plastic Refinery]].
'''PTA''' stands for '''Purified Terephthalic Acid''' which is an organic compound used in the synthesis of [[Plastic|Plastics]].
Selling of '''PTA''' is heavily discouraged, as the latter only sells for a mediocre {{Money|2.9}}, far more less than any product made by [[Plastic Pellets]]
==Usage== '''PTA''' can then be combined with [[MEG]] in a [[Plastic Production Facility]] to create [[Plastic Pellets]], a required material to creating products like [[Gearbox|Gearboxes]], [[Uncharged Lithium-Ion Battery|Lithium Batteries]], [[Plastic Bottle|Bottles]], and [[Microchip|Microchips]].
==Recipes== {{Production|input1=paraxylene|time=4|Mamyflux=60kMF|output1=pta|machine=Plastic Refinery|Input1Amount=1|Output1Amount=2|input2=acetic-acid|Input2Amount=4}} {{Production|input1=meg|time=6|Mamyflux=80kMF|output1=plastic-pellets|machine=Plastic Production Facility|Input1Amount=1|Output1Amount=80|input2=pta|Input2Amount=1}}
==Trivia== *'''Purified terephthalic acid (PTA)''', one of the largest-volume commodity chemicals, is predominantly used for producing saturated polyesters, mainly polyethylene terephthalate (PET) and related polymer products such as fibers, resins, thin films, bottles, etc. A small portion of terephthalic acid is used in the production of semi-aromatic and aromatic polyamides and intermediate chemicals such as cyclohexanedimethanol, terephthaloyl chloride, liquid crystal polymer, etc. *Usually, '''PTA''' is produced in a two-stage process. In the first stage, crude terephthalic acid (CTA) is produced by liquid-phase oxidation of [[Paraxylene|para-xylene]] (p-xylene) in [[Acetic Acid]] medium in the presence of a cobalt acetate and manganese acetate catalyst with hydrogen bromide as a source of bromine promotor. Typically, CTA contains impurities such as 4-carboxybenzaldehyde (4-CBA), p-tolualdehyde, benzoic acid, and p-toluic acid, which are responsible for changing the color of the final product. In the second stage, CTA produced by the oxidation reaction is then purified through hydrogenation. Purification of CTA typically requires at least one chemical transformation (e.g., hydrogenation) in addition to a physical procedures such as crystallization, filtration, and drying to produce the final '''PTA''' product. Purification of '''PTA''' is necessary to achieve high-purity and high-value product. *'''PTA''' was the second acid added to the game, along with [[Acetic Acid]]. *Although '''PTA''' is an acid, players cannot use it to refine [[Gold]] with the [[Gold Acid Refinery]] or use it to make [[Coal]] from [[Earth Fragments|Deep Earth Fragments]]. It is also incompatible with the [[Mineshaft Drill|Mineshaft Drill's]] acid input.
[[Category:Items]] [[Category:Oil based items]] {{Items Navbox}}

revision.text: {{Item|itemImage=Icon-purple-gold-ingot.png|research=Alloyer|sellValue={{Money|20,000}}|resValue={{RP|100x }}}} ==Information== '''Purple Gold Ingots''' were added in update {{Update|0.8.0}} and are one of the most [[Resource Sell Price|expensive]] items to produce in game, selling for significantly less than [[Microchip|Microchips]]. '''Purple Gold Ingots''' are crafted by running two liters of [[Molten Purple Gold]] through an [[Ingot Molder]]. Since Purple Gold Ingots are end game items, it is recommended to only produce it after obtaining {{Money|4,000,000}}. '''Purple Gold Ingots''' are a combination of [[Aluminium Ingot|Aluminium Ingots]] and [[Gold Ingot|Gold Ingots]] in an [[Alloyer]]. ==Usage== '''Purple Gold''' is one of the highest selling items in the game for {{Money|20,000}} depending on karat and serves no other purpose as the final product in the '''Purple Gold '''production chain other than unlocking the {{Node|Precision Assembler}} research. == Recipes == {{Production|input1=molten-purple-gold|Input1Amount=4|Mamyflux=150MF|time=4|output1=purple-gold-ingot|Output1Amount=2|machine=Ingot Molder}} ==How To Make== [[File:Purple Gold Ingot Chart.png|thumb|870x870px]] [[Category:Items]] {{Items Navbox}}

revision.text:
{{Top-bottle}}{{Item|research=Water Bottling|sellValue={{Money|0|size=8}}|itemImage=Icon-residue-bottle.png|resValue={{RP|0x }}}} ==Information== {{Quote|Icon does not resemble reality.}}'''Residue Bottles''' are made by processing both a [[Bottle|Plastic Bottle]] and 8 Litres of [[Residue]] inside a [[Bottling Plant]]. Bottling and selling this item is one of four (three on [[Game Difficulties#Difficulties|Hard]] mode and above) ways to dispose of the unwanted [[Residue]]. In this process, eight litres of [[Residue]] are bottled into one [[Plastic Bottle]], resulting in a '''Residue Bottle''' which is then to be sold.
==Usage== Selling a '''Residue Bottle''' grants {{Money|0}} per unit, alongside the {{Badge|"Neutralized"}}. This bottling process is by far the most complicated way of disposing of [[Residue]], due to the involvement of an entire [[Plastic Bottle]] production chain. Additionally, it is generally better to sell the produced [[Plastic Bottle|Plastic Bottles]] and [[Residue]] separately as you will make [[Money]].
As mentioned before, selling its base components results in a net positive in net worth. The mathematical breakdown of this is:<math>Net worth = (8*ResidueCost) + Plastic BottleCost = (8*-5.8) + 72.5 = -46.4 + 72.5 = 26.1</math>
In summary, selling the [[Residue]] and [[Plastic Bottle]] separately will result in a profit of {{Money|26.1}}, not accounting actually filling said [[Plastic Bottle]] before its sale. If the aforementioned [[Plastic Bottle]] were to be filled with [[Water]], the profit margin would increase to {{Money|84.1}}.
Another reason why producing '''Residue Bottles''' to dispose of [[Residue]] should be avoided is, due to the fact that, by the time that the player unlocks [[Plastic Pellets|Plastic]] production, there is so much [[Residue]] being produced that creating a large plastic setup just for bottling residue would be impractical as it would cost a lot in terms of [[Money]], models, and [[Pollution]].
== Recipes == {{Production|input1=residue|Input1Amount=8|input2=plastic-bottle|Input2Amount=1|time=3.5|Mamyflux=2.86kMF|Output1Amount=1|output1=residue-bottle|machine=Bottling Plant}} {{Items Navbox}}

revision.text:
{| class="wikitable mw-collapsible mw-collapsed" |+Old Usage Section (to preserve for use in a guide or be deleted later) !The '''Lithium Ore''' Production Line (LIPL)
# '''Lithium Ore''' is extracted with the [[Lithium Ore Drill]]. # '''Lithium Ore''', [[Sulfuric Acid]], and [[Sodium Carbonate]] are placed into a [[Chemical Reactor]] to produce [[Lithium Sulfate]] # The [[Lithium Sulfate]] is routed into another [[Chemical Reactor]], though this time combined with [[Water]] and [[Sodium Carbonate]] in order to create [[Lithium Carbonate]]. # The resulting [[Lithium Carbonate]] is then input in an [[Advanced Assembler]], alongside [[Plastic Pellets]] and [[Graphite-Iron Electrode|Graphite-Iron Electrodes]]. This results in an [[Uncharged Lithium-Ion Battery]]. # The aforementioned [[Uncharged Lithium-Ion Battery|Uncharged Lithium-Ion Batteries]] are charged in a [[Battery Charger]], and the produced [[Charged Lithium-Ion Battery|Charged Lithium-Ion Batteries]] are combined with [[Rubber]] and [[Copper Plate|Copper Plates]] in an [[Advanced Assembler]]. [[Lithium Battery Pack|Lithium Battery Packs]] are produced from this final step.
Extra steps for those needing the full production chain. Exact details are posted on their respective machine pages.
==== [[Sulfuric Acid]] production ====
# Use the [[Advanced Oil Separator]] to produce [[Hydrogen Sulfide]]. # Use the [[Oxidation Plant]] to convert said [[Hydrogen Sulfide]] to [[Liquid Sulfur]]. # Use the [[Industrial Firebox]] to produce [[Sulfur Dioxide]] from [[Liquid Sulfur]]. # Use the [[Oxidation Plant]] once again to process the [[Sulfur Dioxide]] into [[Sulfur Trioxide]]. # Use the [[Chemical Reactor]] to change the [[Sulfur Trioxide]] into [[Sulfuric Acid]].
==== [[Sodium Carbonate]] production ====
# Input [[Oak Log|Oak Logs]] and [[Water]] into the [[Industrial Firebox]] to turn [[Oak Log|Oak Logs]] into [[Sodium Carbonate]].
==== [[Graphite-Iron Electrode]] production ====
# Use the [[Precision Assembler]] to manufacture [[Graphite-Iron Electrode|Graphite-Iron Electrodes]] from [[Coal]] and [[Iron Ingot|Iron Ingots]].
==== [[Plastic Pellets]] production ====
===== [[PTA]] production =====
# Use the [[Steam Cracking Plant]] to produce [[Paraxylene]] and [[Ethylene]] from [[Crude Oil]] and [[Steam]]. # Use the [[Plastic Refinery]] to process [[Crude Oil]] and [[Water]] into [[Ethanol]]. # Use the [[Oxidation Plant]] to oxidize the resulting [[Ethanol]] into [[Acetic Acid]] # Use the [[Plastic Refinery]] once again to create [[PTA]] from [[Paraxylene]] and [[Acetic Acid]].
===== [[MEG]] production =====
# Use [[Oxidation Plant]] to convert [[Ethylene]] into [[MEG]].
===== [[Plastic Pellets]] production =====
# Use the [[Plastic Production Facility]] to synthesize [[Plastic Pellets]] from [[PTA]] and [[MEG]]. |} {{Item|sellValue={{Money|10}}|itemImage=Icon-lithium-ore.png|research=Lithium|resValue={{RP|1x }}}} ==Information== '''Lithium Ore''' is a raw item obtained using a [[Lithium Ore Drill]], which requires two liters of [[Machine Oil]] to function. It is used to make [[Lithium Battery Pack|Lithium Battery Packs]].
==Usage== '''Lithium Ore''' is exclusively used for the production of [[Lithium Sulfate]] in a [[Chemical Reactor]] with [[Sulfuric Acid]] and [[Sodium Carbonate]]. This is then used in the production of [[Lithium Carbonate]] in another [[Chemical Reactor]] fed with [[Sodium Carbonate]] and [[Water]].
The [[Lithium Carbonate]] is then input into the [[Advanced Assembler]] with [[Graphite-Iron Electrode|Graphite-Iron Electrodes]] and [[Plastic Pellets]] to create [[Uncharged Lithium-Ion Battery|Uncharged Lithium-Ion Batteries]], which after charging may be used in the production of [[Lithium Battery Pack|Lithium Battery Packs]].
== Recipes == {{Production|input1=machine-oil|Input1Amount=2|Mamyflux=1MMF|time=10|output1=lithium-ore|Output1Amount=10|machine=Lithium Ore Drill}} {{Production|input1=sulfuric-acid|Input1Amount=1.4|input2=lithium-ore|Input2Amount=4|input3=sodium-carbonate|Input3Amount=2|time=2|Mamyflux=1.5MMF|output1=lithium-sulfate|Output1Amount=4|machine=Chemical Reactor}} {{Production|input1=lithium-ore|Input1Amount=4|input2=sodium-carbonate|Input2Amount=8|Mamyflux=500kMF|time=4|output1=lithium-carbonate|Output1Amount=18|output2=residue|Output2Amount=20|machine=Ore Enrichment Facility|input3=sulfuric-acid|Input3Amount=6|input4=distilled-water|Input4Amount=10}} {{Items Navbox}}

revision.text:
{{Item|research=Huge Coal Power Plant|sellValue={{Money|-0.5}}|itemImage=icon-exhaust.png|resValue={{RP|0x }}}} ==Information== '''Exhaust''' is a byproduct of running the [[Coal Power Plant]], with the amount produced depending on how much [[Coal]] is burned per second and how high the Exhaust Pump dial is set inside the [[Coal Power Plant]]. Unlike [[Residue]], it cannot be used in any recipes whereas the former can be bottled in a [[Bottling Plant]] for [[Residue Bottle|Residue Bottles]].
==Usage== Just like [[Residue]], '''Exhaust''' serves no purpose. In addition to how other fluids can be disposed of (selling, dumping or storing), '''Exhaust''' can be destroyed using an [[Exhaust Stack]]. Because of the [[Coal Power Plant]] producing '''Exhaust''' at such a high rate, this is widely considered the best option by far. [[Filter|Filters]] may be used to divide the [[Pollution]] generated this way by 8.
==Trivia== *Alongside [[Residue]], '''Exhaust''' is one of the only two fluids that sells for negative [[Money]]. *The icon for '''Exhaust''' is a retextured, more crunchy image of the [[Low Pressure Steam|Low Pressure Steam's]] current icon.
{{Items Navbox}} [[Category:Items with a negative sell price]]
